channel.title: Black Mesa "preparing to launch" brief black screen, then nothing...
channel.description:
I finally managed to get the game downloaded, installed, and to show up in Steam. But now when I press play, the grey box comes up and says "Preparing to launch Black Mesa...", a brief black square appears, then nothing happens. Any help would be just the greatest.
(BTW thank you development team for making this game.) :smiley:

item.title: Black Mesa "preparing to launch" brief black screen, then nothing...
item.dc:creator: Neo-Calypso
item.description:
snb:

Add -fs and/or -fullscreen to the launch options. Fixed it for me.

Wow after maybe 3 hours trying to get this to work, messing with DLLs and changing gameids, and whatnot. Something as simple as just forcing the game to go fullscreen finally fixes it. Thanks a lot dude.

item.title: Black Mesa "preparing to launch" brief black screen, then nothing...
item.dc:creator: Neo-Calypso
item.description:
Aramageshu:

I finally managed to get the game downloaded, installed, and to show up in Steam. But now when I press play, the grey box comes up and says “Preparing to launch Black Mesa…”, a brief black square appears, then nothing happens. Any help would be just the greatest.

(BTW thank you development team for making this game.)

You are in I think the same situation as myself. I’ve figured out what the problem is but have not yet figured out the solution to fixing it. I have my Steam installed on my non-OS drive which has the label of [b]F:[/b]. When I try to run BMS I get a steam promt that says “preparing to launch Black Mesa”. Then I get a quick flash of what I assume is HL2.exe then it shuts down as quickly as it appeared. I then read that installing the mod into the default “C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\sourcemods\BMS” directory works and sure enough the game did finally run(even though steam is on a completely different drive along wish Source SDK) once the installer finished and I left the “Run Black Mesa” checkbox checked on the installer.

However once I quit the game to try and get it to run in a borderless window the game would no longer start up again and I realized it was because Steam was still trying to run the mod in from the steam folder on [b]F:[/b] instead of the working one on [b]C:[/b]. So either I’ve got to figure out a way to make steam use the sourcemods folder on [b]C:[/b], Or make BMS realize the installation is on [b]F:[/b] properly.
